cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 380 miles SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north now, forecast to turn north-northwest then northwest toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: west of Intracoastal City, LA to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: U.S. Gulf Coast from the central Texas coast to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (25–35 mph with gusts to 45 mph) possible Wednesday, especially if the center tracks a little farther west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–3 ft possible along the southwest Louisiana coast near Cameron; little direct surge threat inside the Lake Charles channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with localized higher totals, producing brief port-area flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents in the approaches; reduced visibilities in squalls may disrupt vessel movements.
